column3: tiles at the start of a level
tiles added each time the player makes a move; this should take fractional numbers and add the extra tile when needed. So 1.5 would mean alternating between 1 and 2 tiles
tiles added when a new customer is added
the value of tiles of this type when they first come in. This will be used to test harder levels, and eventually would be controlled by an upgrade system
amount of coins given for each happiness level over the threshold
level of happiness that must be exceeded for a tip
maximum customers that can leave before level is failed
The number of coins given per item; So 2 cookies pays 2x. This will probably change to it's own table or a formula
number of coins it costs to start this day
number of turns before it's closing time
number of coins earned for a successful day

column3: Valid customer types: Biker, Granny, Hipster, Teenager

column5: Valid item types: Bread, Cupcake, Donut, Cookie, Cake
